trans-unit.source: Using vault credentials to authenticate with the Azure Backup service
trans-unit.target: Using vault credentials to authenticate with the Azure Backup service

trans-unit.source: The on-premises server (Windows client or Windows Server or Data Protection Manager server) needs to be authenticated with a backup vault before it can back up data to Azure.
trans-unit.target: The on-premises server (Windows client or Windows Server or Data Protection Manager server) needs to be authenticated with a backup vault before it can back up data to Azure.

trans-unit.source: The authentication is achieved using “vault credentials”.
trans-unit.target: The authentication is achieved using “vault credentials”.

trans-unit.source: The concept of vault credentials is similar to the concept of a “publish settings” file which is used in Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The concept of vault credentials is similar to the concept of a “publish settings” file which is used in Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: What is the vault credential file?
trans-unit.target: What is the vault credential file?

trans-unit.source: The vault credentials file is a certificate generated by the portal for each backup vault.
trans-unit.target: The vault credentials file is a certificate generated by the portal for each backup vault.

trans-unit.source: The portal then uploads the public key to the Access Control Service (ACS).
trans-unit.target: The portal then uploads the public key to the Access Control Service (ACS).

trans-unit.source: The private key of the certificate is made available to the user as part of the workflow which is given as an input in the machine registration workflow.
trans-unit.target: The private key of the certificate is made available to the user as part of the workflow which is given as an input in the machine registration workflow.

trans-unit.source: This authenticates the machine to send backup data to an identified vault in the Azure Backup service.
trans-unit.target: This authenticates the machine to send backup data to an identified vault in the Azure Backup service.

trans-unit.source: The vault credential is used only during the registration workflow.
trans-unit.target: The vault credential is used only during the registration workflow.

trans-unit.source: It is the user’s responsibility to ensure that the vault credentials file is not compromised.
trans-unit.target: It is the user’s responsibility to ensure that the vault credentials file is not compromised.

trans-unit.source: If it falls in the hands of any rogue-user, the vault credentials file can be used to register other machines against the same vault.
trans-unit.target: If it falls in the hands of any rogue-user, the vault credentials file can be used to register other machines against the same vault.

trans-unit.source: However, as the backup data is encrypted using a passphrase which belongs to the customer, existing backup data cannot be compromised.
trans-unit.target: However, as the backup data is encrypted using a passphrase which belongs to the customer, existing backup data cannot be compromised.

trans-unit.source: To mitigate this concern, vault credentials are set to expire in 48hrs.
trans-unit.target: To mitigate this concern, vault credentials are set to expire in 48hrs.

trans-unit.source: You can download the vault credentials of a backup vault any number of times – but only the latest vault credential file is applicable during the registration workflow.
trans-unit.target: You can download the vault credentials of a backup vault any number of times – but only the latest vault credential file is applicable during the registration workflow.

trans-unit.source: Download the vault credential file
trans-unit.target: Download the vault credential file

trans-unit.source: The vault credential file is downloaded through a secure channel from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: The vault credential file is downloaded through a secure channel from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Backup service is unaware of the private key of the certificate and the private key is not persisted in the portal or the service.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Backup service is unaware of the private key of the certificate and the private key is not persisted in the portal or the service.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to download the vault credential file to a local machine.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to download the vault credential file to a local machine.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/)
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/)

trans-unit.source: Click on **Recovery Services** in the left navigation pane and select the backup vault which you have created.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Recovery Services** in the left navigation pane and select the backup vault which you have created.

trans-unit.source: Click on the cloud icon to get to the Quick Start view of the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: Click on the cloud icon to get to the Quick Start view of the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Quick view
trans-unit.target: Quick view

trans-unit.source: On the Quick Start page, click **Download vault credentials**.
trans-unit.target: On the Quick Start page, click **Download vault credentials**.

trans-unit.source: The portal generates the vault credential file, which is made available for download.
trans-unit.target: The portal generates the vault credential file, which is made available for download.

trans-unit.source: Download
trans-unit.target: Download

trans-unit.source: The portal will generate a vault credential using a combination of the vault name and the current date.
trans-unit.target: The portal will generate a vault credential using a combination of the vault name and the current date.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to download the vault credentials to the local account's downloads folder, or select Save As from the Save menu to specify a location for the vault credentials.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to download the vault credentials to the local account's downloads folder, or select Save As from the Save menu to specify a location for the vault credentials.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the vault credentials is saved in a location which can be accessed from your machine.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the vault credentials is saved in a location which can be accessed from your machine.

trans-unit.source: If it is stored in a file share/SMB, check for the access permissions.
trans-unit.target: If it is stored in a file share/SMB, check for the access permissions.

trans-unit.source: The vault credentials file is used only during the registration workflow.
trans-unit.target: The vault credentials file is used only during the registration workflow.

trans-unit.source: The vault credentials file expires after 48hrs and can be downloaded from the portal.
trans-unit.target: The vault credentials file expires after 48hrs and can be downloaded from the portal.
